intro: Macraea myrtifolia, commonly known as the myrtle-leaved macraea, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, lance-shaped leaves that resemble those of myrtle. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by spherical, woody fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
